summary:
The Security Council,
Recalling previous relevant resolutions, 
Condemns the 14 February 2005 terrorist bombing and other attacks in Lebanon, 
Examined the report of the International Independent Investigation Commission (The Commission),
 Commends the Commission's work, 
 Takes note of Lebanon's request to extend the Commission's mandate, 
 Notes the Commission's conclusion that it won't complete its work before its current mandate expires,

1. Welcomes the Commission's report; 
2. Decides to extend the Commission's mandate until 15 June 2008 and declares readiness to terminate it earlier if the Commission reports completion of its mandate; 
3. Requests the Commission to report to the Council every four months on investigation progress; 
4. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
